intro: Calystegia macounii, commonly known as the Macoun's morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the morning, hence its common name. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often twining. Calystegia macounii is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks.
